modules.description: This module generates HTML layouts for Minima pages, providing functions to construct complete HTML documents and common page structures. It works with HTML nodes, URIs, timestamps, and metadata such as page titles, descriptions, and contact links. Concrete use cases include rendering blog homepages with post listings, generating article pages with dates, and building full HTML documents with headers, footers, and stylesheets.

This module provides a handler for rendering HTML templates based on the Minima theme, with a function to construct the handler using a specified base directory. It works with string paths, Soup nodes, and URIs, primarily manipulating HTML structures through template instantiation. Concrete use cases include generating static website pages by loading and modifying HTML templates from a file system or embedded resources.

This module generates reusable HTML fragments for building static sites, including header, footer, and icon elements. It works with strings, URIs, and a theme type to produce structured HTML nodes used in layout composition. Concrete use cases include rendering navigation bars, metadata in document heads, and social media icons linked to external profiles.
